page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content:
The village of Okeford Fitzpaine is lucky to have a large number of picturesque old cottages dating back to the 18th century and beyond. However, it also has a large estate, built in the 1930's and 1950's, which provides housing for young families and those on lower incomes. There is a new housing estate of about 14 homes, built in 1985,which have been designed as family housing. There are plans for further small developments of this type.
Unfortunately, young people are being forced away from the village because of the difficulty in finding suitable accommodation, while the area has increased in its popularity for retirement housing.
